translated: There is no downfall if the legs are inserted or if it is supported.

original: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner; if he is insane; if his mind is disturbed; if he is in pain; if he is the first offender.

original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bco brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bco brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The eighteenth root downfall is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom @63b ldan 'das ko'u shambhi na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom @63b ldan 'das ko'u shambhi na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in the Kośala country in the grove of the Kośalan king.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs par byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs par byed /
translated: At that time, the venerable Saṅgharakṣita knowingly used water containing living beings to water grass, clay, and earth,

original: 'debs su 'jug par byed nas /
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug par byed nas /
translated: and had others do the same.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: The monks said to him,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la ma 'debs shig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la ma 'debs shig /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, don’t knowingly use water containing living beings to water grass, clay, and earth.

original: 'debs su ma 'jug cig /
analyzed: 'debs su ma 'jug cig /
translated: Don’t have others do the same.”

original: 'dun pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dun pas smras pa /
translated: Saṅgharakṣita said,

original: kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te gtad dam ci /
analyzed: kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te gtad dam ci /
translated: “Why should I be counted and entrusted with this?”

original: shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /🔽lho dang nub dang byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
analyzed: shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes / lho dang nub dang byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
translated: “What is wrong with going to the great ocean in the east?🔽What is wrong with going to the great ocean in the south, in the west, or in the north?

original: 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / lteng ka dag tu 'dong na ci nyes /
analyzed: 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / lteng ka dag tu 'dong na ci nyes /
translated: What is wrong with going to rivers, lakes, or ponds?🔽Why do monks knowingly use water containing living beings to water grass, clay, or earth, or to have others water it?”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jug par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jug par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, having understood the situation, knowing the time, having thought about it, having reflected on it, having risen from his seat, and having gone to the assembly hall, sat down on the seat prepared for him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One addressed the monks:🔽“Monks, you should not knowingly use water containing living beings to water grass, clay, or earth, or to have others water it.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas know and ask about this.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la rmas pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha asked the venerable Saṅgharakṣita:

original: 'dun pa khyed shes bzhin du srog chags dang @64a *//
analyzed: 'dun pa khyed shes bzhin du srog chags dang @64a *//
translated: “Saṅgharakṣita, is it true that you, knowing that the water contains living creatures,🔽watered grass and clay with it, or had it watered?”

original: bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jug par byed pa bden nam /🔽btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jug par byed pa bden nam / btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, it’s true, O Honored One.”🔽The Blessed Buddha rebuked him,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “Worthless man, this is not fitting,🔽it’s not allowable,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it’s not proper,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: it’s not worthy of a renunciant, it’s not to be done.🔽How can you, knowing that the water contains living creatures, water grass and clay with it, or have it watered?🔽Worthless man, have you not trained in the scriptures?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: The Blessed One rebuked him in many ways and also spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support and being insatiable,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: and after rebuking him and speaking in dispraise, he addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Therefore, monks, having seen ten benefits, I establish a training rule for the monks, and so on as before.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva'am lci ba'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva'am lci ba'am /
translated: “My disciples, in this way you should recite this training rule:

original: sa la 'debs sam sa la 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do //
analyzed: sa la 'debs sam sa la 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do //
translated: ‘If a monk knowingly pours water containing living beings onto grass, clay, or earth, or has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The monk: refers to a lustful monk or any other monk of that kind.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: Knowingly: he himself knows or others tell him.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la srog chags dang bcas pa ni gnyis te; gang dag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la srog chags dang bcas pa ni gnyis te; gang dag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “With living beings” means two things: those that can be seen with the eye, and those that are caught in a strainer.

original: chus zhes bya ba ni chu nyid kyis so //🔽rtsva zhes bya ba ni rtsva nyid do //
analyzed: chus zhes bya ba ni chu nyid kyis so // rtsva zhes bya ba ni rtsva nyid do //
translated: “Water” means water itself.🔽“Grass” means grass itself.

original: lci ba zhes bya ba yang @64b lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: lci ba zhes bya ba yang @64b lci ba nyid do //
translated: “Mud” means mud itself.

original: sa zhes bya ba yang sa nyid la'o //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba yang sa nyid la'o //
translated: “Earth” means earth itself.

original: 'debs sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
analyzed: 'debs sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
translated: “Spreads” means to do it oneself.

original: 'debs su 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Causes to spread” means to get someone else to do it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: “Offense” means to burn, to boil, and to fall into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of hungry ghosts—into bad rebirths, bad destinies, and downward-leading paths.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Burns” means to burn.🔽“Boils” means to boil.🔽“Makes fall” means to make fall.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing /
translated: “As long as” means as long as that offense has not been confessed,

original: so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit this downfall?

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk, perceiving water that contains living beings as containing living beings, pours it on grass, earth, or clay,

original: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: or has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk, perceiving water that contains living beings as containing living beings, pours it on grass, earth, or clay,

original: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: or has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk, perceiving water that does not contain living beings as containing living beings, pours it on grass, earth, or clay,

original: 'debs su 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or has it poured, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas rtsva'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs sam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk, perceiving water that does not contain living beings as containing living beings, pours it on grass, earth, or clay,🔽or has it poured, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'debs su 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he makes someone else plant it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i yur po che 'debs par byed na /🔽srog chags ji snyed dus byed pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i yur po che 'debs par byed na / srog chags ji snyed dus byed pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk plants a canal with living beings,🔽he commits as many offenses of wrong conduct as there are living beings that die.

original: srog chags ji snyed dus mi byed pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags ji snyed dus mi byed pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: He commits as many offenses of wrong conduct as there are living beings that do not die.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas @65a *//🔽pa'i yur po che gcod par byed na /🔽srog chags ji snyed dus byed pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas @65a *// pa'i yur po che gcod par byed na / srog chags ji snyed dus byed pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk cuts a canal with living beings,🔽he commits as many offenses of wrong conduct as there are living beings that die.

original: srog chags ji snyed dus mi byed pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags ji snyed dus mi byed pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: He commits as many offenses of wrong conduct as there are living beings that do not die.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is a beginner; if he is insane; if his mind is disturbed; if he is suffering; if he does not know; or if he is not seeking to harm living beings.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The nineteenth training rule is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ko'u shambhi na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ko'u shambhi na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kośala country in the Ghoṣira Grove.

original: drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing de dag de na gnas pa na dga' bo nye dga' ltos shig /
analyzed: drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing de dag de na gnas pa na dga' bo nye dga' ltos shig /
translated: The group-of-six monks stayed in monasteries built by others. While staying there, they said, “Look, Nanda and Upananda!

original: gtsug lag khang ni gyong grugs su gyur pa yin no //🔽'di ni gas pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni gyong grugs su gyur pa yin no // 'di ni gas pa yin no //
translated: The monastery is in bad shape.🔽This is cracked.

original: 'di ni mtshams nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshams nyams pa yin no //
translated: This is damaged.🔽This is broken. This is like a house of prostitutes.”

original: 'di ni ngos nyams pa yin no; ;'di ni ma mo'i khyim 'dra ba yin no zhes 'phya bar byed pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ni ngos nyams pa yin no; ;'di ni ma mo'i khyim 'dra ba yin no zhes 'phya bar byed pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
translated: The monks said to them,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag re zhig gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag re zhig gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing /
translated: “Venerables, you stay in monasteries built by others,

original: khyed cag gis rdo yang sgreng bar mi nus la 'on kyang 'phya bar byed do //
analyzed: khyed cag gis rdo yang sgreng bar mi nus la 'on kyang 'phya bar byed do //
translated: and you can’t even put up a stone, yet you criticize.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / de dag nga rgyal gyis khengs par gyur nas /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / de dag nga rgyal gyis khengs par gyur nas /
translated: When they had said this, they became arrogant.

original: phan tshun smras par brtsams pa /
analyzed: phan tshun smras par brtsams pa /
translated: They began to say to one another,

original: dga' bo nye dga' lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag gis bdag cag la khyed cag re zhig gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing khyed cag gis rdo yang @65b sgreng bar mi nus la 'on kyang 'phya bar byed do zhes ha
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag gis bdag cag la khyed cag re zhig gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing khyed cag gis rdo yang @65b sgreng bar mi nus la 'on kyang 'phya bar byed do zhes ha
translated: “These black-bowl holders, Nanda and Upananda, say to us, ‘You are staying in monasteries that others have made for you, and you are not able to erect even a stone, yet you are mocking us.’

original: cang zil gyis mnan gyi /
analyzed: cang zil gyis mnan gyi /
translated: They are oppressing us too much.

original: tshur sheg bdag cag gis sngon lhung bzed nag po can gang gis kyang byed du ma bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang ci 'dra ba'i gtsug lag khang byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: tshur sheg bdag cag gis sngon lhung bzed nag po can gang gis kyang byed du ma bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang ci 'dra ba'i gtsug lag khang byed du gzhug go /
translated: Let us build a monastery that no black-bowl holder has ever used before.

original: gal te bdag cag thams cad lag gi bla la brtson par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag cag thams cad lag gi bla la brtson par gyur na /
translated: If all of us work with our own hands,

original: lhung bzed nag po can dag rtag pa kho nar bdag cag la skabs tshol bas /
analyzed: lhung bzed nag po can dag rtag pa kho nar bdag cag la skabs tshol bas /
translated: the black-bowl holders will always be looking for an opportunity to harm us.

original: de dag gis drug sde dag thams cad lag gi bla la zhugs so zhes skabs rnyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag gis drug sde dag thams cad lag gi bla la zhugs so zhes skabs rnyed par 'gyur la /
translated: They will find an opportunity to say, ‘The group of six are all up to their elbows in it.’

original: bdag cag gi slong mo'i khyim gang dag yin pa de dag tu yang brel ba dag gi skyon brjod nas rjes su 'jug par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gi slong mo'i khyim gang dag yin pa de dag tu yang brel ba dag gi skyon brjod nas rjes su 'jug par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And they will go to our alms-giving households and, having spoken of the faults of the busy ones, will make them turn away.

original: bdag cag gis bdag cag gi nang na mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba /
analyzed: bdag cag gis bdag cag gi nang na mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba /
translated: We should definitely go to the one among us who is skilled, clear in his conduct,

original: khab gzhug par gtun bu 'jug nus pa gang yin pa de'i gan du bdag cag dong la spro ba skyed par bya gor ma chag na /
analyzed: khab gzhug par gtun bu 'jug nus pa gang yin pa de'i gan du bdag cag dong la spro ba skyed par bya gor ma chag na /
translated: and able to insert a pestle into a keyhole, and encourage him.

original: de'i phyir bdag cag gi nang na mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag cag gi nang na mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba /
translated: Therefore, the one among us who is skilled, clear in his conduct,

original: khab gzhug par gtun bu 'jud par nus pa gang yin pa bdag cag gi nang na /
analyzed: khab gzhug par gtun bu 'jud par nus pa gang yin pa bdag cag gi nang na /
translated: and able to insert a pestle into a keyhole,🔽is the venerable Saṅgharakṣita.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba /
translated: He is skilled, clear in his conduct,

original: khab gzhug par gtun bu 'jud nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khab gzhug par gtun bu 'jud nus pa yin gyi /
translated: and able to insert a pestle into a keyhole.

original: bdag cag de'i gan du song la spro ba bskyed par bya'o zhes de dag 'dun pa'i gan du dong ste smras pa /
analyzed: bdag cag de'i gan du song la spro ba bskyed par bya'o zhes de dag 'dun pa'i gan du dong ste smras pa /
translated: We should go to him and encourage him.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag gis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag gis /
translated: They went to Saṅgharakṣita and said, Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, these monks with black bowls

original: bdag cag la re zhig gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang dag na gnas shing /

analyzed: nang gi sha'i tshogs zhes bya ba de ni nang gi skye mched drug po dag gi tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: The phrase “the collection of inner flesh” is a designation for the six inner sense spheres.

original: phyi rol gyi pags pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba de ni phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag gi tshig bla dvags yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi pags pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba de ni phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag gi tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: The phrase “the collection of outer skin” is a designation for the six outer sense spheres.

original: bar gyi chu rgyus dang bar gyi glo ba dang @83b bar gyi mchin pa dang / bar gyi rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba de ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyi tshig bla dvags yin no //🔽ba lang gsod pa'am /
analyzed: bar gyi chu rgyus dang bar gyi glo ba dang @83b bar gyi mchin pa dang / bar gyi rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba de ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyi tshig bla dvags yin no // ba lang gsod pa'am /
translated: The phrase “the inner tendons, the inner lungs, the inner liver, and the inner intestines” is a designation for the attachment to pleasure.🔽The phrase “a butcher” is a designation for a bodhisattva.

original: ba lang gsod pa'i slob ma mkhas pa zhes bya ba de ni 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa'i tshig bla dvags yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gsod pa'i slob ma mkhas pa zhes bya ba de ni 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa'i tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: The phrase “a skilled apprentice of a butcher” is a designation for a learned noble disciple.

original: gri zhes bya ba de ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyi tshig bla dvags yin no //
analyzed: gri zhes bya ba de ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyi tshig bla dvags yin no //
translated: The phrase “a knife” is a designation for the weapon of wisdom.

original: sring mo dag 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas shes rab kyi mtshon gyis kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa thams cad kun tu gcod par byed /🔽kun tu 'dral bar byed /
analyzed: sring mo dag 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas shes rab kyi mtshon gyis kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa thams cad kun tu gcod par byed / kun tu 'dral bar byed /
translated: and entanglements with the weapon of wisdom.🔽They cut them through,🔽they cut them apart,

original: kun tu rdung bar byed /
analyzed: kun tu rdung bar byed /
translated: they cut them down,

original: kun tu dmyal bar byed do //
analyzed: kun tu dmyal bar byed do //
translated: and they cut them to pieces.

original: sring mo dag de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: sring mo dag de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: “Sisters, you should train in this way:🔽‘My mind should not be attached to things that cause attachment in order to abandon attachment,

original: 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir chags par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bdag gi sems gang yin pa chags par mi 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bdag gi sems gang yin pa zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir chags par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bdag gi sems gang yin pa chags par mi 'gyur ba dang / zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bdag gi sems gang yin pa zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: and my mind should not be averse to things that cause aversion in order to abandon aversion.’

original: gti mug spang ba'i phyir rmongs par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bdag gi sems gang yin pa rmongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug spang ba'i phyir rmongs par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la bdag gi sems gang yin pa rmongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon delusion, I will train my mind so that it is not deluded about the phenomena that cause delusion.

original: sring mo dag de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: sring mo dag de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: “Sisters, therefore, you should train thinking,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la 'byung ba dang / 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la 'byung ba dang / 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas par bya'o //
translated: ‘I will remain watching the arising and passing away of the five acquired aggregates.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po dag la kun 'byung ba dang nub par 'gyur bar rjes su lta zhing gnas par bya'o //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la sems nye bar bzhag @84a *//
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po dag la kun 'byung ba dang nub par 'gyur bar rjes su lta zhing gnas par bya'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la sems nye bar bzhag @84a *//
translated: I will remain watching the arising and passing away of the six sense sources.

original: cing gnas par bya'o //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag sems legs par nye bar bzhag cing gnas na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dag kun tu bsten par bya /
analyzed: cing gnas par bya'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag sems legs par nye bar bzhag cing gnas na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dag kun tu bsten par bya /
translated: I will remain with my mind well-established in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: goms par bya /
analyzed: goms par bya /
translated: If I remain with my mind well-established in the four establishments of mindfulness, I will rely on, grow accustomed to, and increase the seven factors of awakening.

original: lan mang du bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lan mang du bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: I will train thinking, ‘I will do this.’

original: sring mo dag khyed kyis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dag tu kun tu bsten pa'i rgyu dang / goms par byas pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyu dang / legs par yid la byas pa'i rgyus 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed kyis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po dag tu kun tu bsten pa'i rgyu dang / goms par byas pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyu dang / legs par yid la byas pa'i rgyus 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: “Sisters, by the cause of attending to the seven factors of awakening, by the cause of cultivating them, by the cause of practicing them frequently, and by the cause of properly keeping them in mind, your minds will be free from attachment to the defilements of desire and will be liberated.

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Your minds will be free from attachment to the defilements of existence and the defilements of ignorance and will be liberated.

original: sring mo dag khyed cag rnam par grol ba dag la /
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed cag rnam par grol ba dag la /
translated: “Sisters, in your liberation

original: bdag cag skye ba ni zad /
analyzed: bdag cag skye ba ni zad /
translated: you will know, ‘Our births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten /
translated: We have lived the spiritual life.

original: bya ba ni byas /
analyzed: bya ba ni byas /
translated: We have done what had to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan ni mi shes so zhes rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan ni mi shes so zhes rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: We know of no other existence for ourselves.’

original: sring mo dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Sisters, you should train in this way.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed /
translated: Then the venerable Nandaka

original: dge slong ma de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: dge slong ma de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: He taught the bhikṣuṇīs with a discourse on the Dharma.🔽He inspired them,🔽enthused them,

analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: and delighted them.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, together with five hundred bhikṣuṇīs, went to where the Bhagavān was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: When she arrived, she bowed her head at the Bhagavān’s feet and sat down to one side.

analyzed: mtha' gcig tu @84b 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jud par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: When she had sat down to one side, the Bhagavān taught Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī with a discourse on the Dharma.🔽He inspired her,🔽enthused her,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and delighted her.

original: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: He taught her with many explanations and reasons,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: encouraged her,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas /🔽go'u ta mi khyod kyi dus yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas / go'u ta mi khyod kyi dus yin gyi /
translated: cheered her, and delighted her.🔽Then he said, “Gautami, your time has come.

original: song zhig ces skul bar mdzad do //
analyzed: song zhig ces skul bar mdzad do //
translated: Go forth!🔽

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis /
translated: Then Mahaprajapati Gautami

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
translated: rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: She bowed her head at the Blessed One’s feet

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: and left the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then, not long after Mahaprajapati Gautami had left, the Blessed One

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: understood and said to the monks,🔽“Monks,

analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas /
translated: “Bhikṣus, the son of a good family, Nandīpāla, taught well and instructed well those five hundred bhikṣuṇīs.

original: rnam par grol zhing mthar thug pa nyid ma thob kyang /
analyzed: rnam par grol zhing mthar thug pa nyid ma thob kyang /
translated: Although they did not attain the ultimate of liberation,

original: 'di'i tshe dus byed par gyur na ngas de dag kun tu sbyor ba gang dang ldan pas yang 'jig rten 'dir 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i kun tu sbyor ba gcig ma spangs par yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba la ltos /
analyzed: 'di'i tshe dus byed par gyur na ngas de dag kun tu sbyor ba gang dang ldan pas yang 'jig rten 'dir 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i kun tu sbyor ba gcig ma spangs par yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba la ltos /
translated: look how they did not see any fetters that they had not abandoned, any fetters that would cause them to come back to this world.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, it is like this:

analyzed: zla ba yar gyi ngo de nyid kyi tshes bcu bzhi la bab pa na mi dag zla ba la nya'am nya ma yin zhes @85a *//
translated: On the fourteenth day of the waxing phase of the moon, people ask, ‘Is the moon full or not?’

original: gnyis su 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: gnyis su 'byed par byed de /
translated: They divide it into two.

original: 'di ltar nya ma yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa nyid du ma gyur pa de bzhin du rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag la legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas rnam par grol zhing mthar
analyzed: 'di ltar nya ma yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa nyid du ma gyur pa de bzhin du rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag la legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas rnam par grol zhing mthar
translated: In the same way, son of noble family, Nanda, having instructed and taught the five hundred nuns well, they did not attain complete liberation and reach the end.

original: thug pa nyid ma thob kyang 'di'i tshe dus byed par gyur na /
analyzed: thug pa nyid ma thob kyang 'di'i tshe dus byed par gyur na /
translated: But when their lives ended,

analyzed: ngas de dag kun tu sbyor ba gang dang ldan pa'i yang 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs par 'gyur ba'i kun tu sbyor ba gcig ma spangs bar yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: I did not see a single fetter that they had not abandoned, by which they would have come to this world again.

original: de ltar de na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du lung bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du lung bstan to //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One prophesied that the five hundred nuns would become non-returners.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang lan gnyis su tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yang lan gnyis su tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke a second time to the venerable Nanda:

original: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la soms shig /
analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la soms shig /
translated: Nanda, think of the nuns.

original: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /
analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /
translated: “Nandaka, you should instruct the nuns.

original: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig /
analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig /
translated: Nandaka, you should give a Dharma talk to the nuns.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' byed dge slong ma la nga'am khyod kyis gtams kyang rung zhing /
analyzed: dga' byed dge slong ma la nga'am khyod kyis gtams kyang rung zhing /
translated: Nandaka, it is appropriate for me or you to give a Dharma talk to the nuns.

original: dge slong ma la nga'am khyod kyis rjes su bstan kyang rung la /
analyzed: dge slong ma la nga'am khyod kyis rjes su bstan kyang rung la /
translated: It is appropriate for me or you to instruct the nuns.

original: dge slong ma rnams la nga'am khyod kyis chos dang ldan pa'i gtam byar yang rung ba'i phyir ro //🔽tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las dang du blangs so //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la nga'am khyod kyis chos dang ldan pa'i gtam byar yang rung ba'i phyir ro // tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las dang du blangs so //
translated: It is appropriate for me or you to give a Dharma talk to the nuns.”🔽The venerable Nandaka accepted the Blessed One’s request by remaining silent.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
translated: Then the venerable Nandaka rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das @85b kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @85b kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and left the Blessed One’s presence.🔽Then, after the night had passed, the venerable Nandaka,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: having dressed in the morning,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: took his bowl and his robe, and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: des mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pas /
analyzed: des mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pas /
translated: Having wandered for alms in Śrāvastī, after his meal, returning from his alms round,

analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab ste rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
translated: he put away his bowl and robe, washed his feet, and entered the dwelling for the day’s meditation.

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed phyem bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas snam sbyar thogs te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong dge slong zhig dang dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then the venerable Nandī came out of his solitary meditation, took his outer robe, and went to the nunnery of the king’s pleasure grove, accompanied by a śramaṇa bhikṣu follower and a bhikṣuṇī.

original: dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed thag ring po kho na nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed thag ring po kho na nas mthong ngo //
translated: The bhikṣuṇīs saw the venerable Nandī from a distance.

analyzed: mthong nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi phyir stan shom par byed cing 'di skad ces kyang smras so // btsun pa dga' byed tshur sheg /
translated: Seeing him, they prepared a seat for the venerable Nandī and said this:🔽“Come, Venerable Nandī!

original: btsun pa dga' byed byon pa legs so //🔽btsun pa dga' byed gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa dga' byed byon pa legs so // btsun pa dga' byed gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs su gsol /
translated: Welcome, Venerable Nandī!🔽Venerable Nandī, please sit on the prepared seat.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
translated: The venerable Nandī sat on the prepared seat.

original: de nas dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Then the bhikṣuṇīs bowed low until their foreheads touched the feet of the venerable Nandika and sat down to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis dge slong ma de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par byed /🔽yang dag par @86a *//
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis dge slong ma de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par byed / yang dag par @86a *//
translated: When they had sat down to one side, the venerable Nandika taught the bhikṣuṇīs the Dharma.

original: 'dzin tu 'jud par byed /🔽yang dag par gzengs stod par byed /
analyzed: 'dzin tu 'jud par byed / yang dag par gzengs stod par byed /
translated: He incited, inspired,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed /
translated: animated, and delighted them.🔽He explained, expounded,🔽and clarified it in various ways.

original: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: Having taught the bhikṣuṇīs the Dharma in various ways,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: having incited, inspired,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: animated, and delighted them, he rose from his seat and departed.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste /
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, together with five hundred bhikṣuṇīs, went to where the Bhagavān was.

original: phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas / bcom ldan 'das skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
translated: Having sat to one side,🔽the Blessed One, with a Dharma discourse, instructed,🔽inspired,

original: yang dag par 'dzin tu 'jug par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin tu 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: enthused, and delighted Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin tu bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin tu bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: With a Dharma discourse of various kinds, he instructed,🔽inspired,🔽enthused, and delighted her.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas /🔽go'u ta mi khyod kyi dus yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas / go'u ta mi khyod kyi dus yin gyi /
translated: Having instructed, inspired,🔽enthused, and delighted her with a Dharma discourse of various kinds,🔽he urged her, saying, “Gautamī, your time has come.

original: song zhig / ces skul bar mdzad do //
analyzed: song zhig / ces skul bar mdzad do //
translated: Go now.”

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: She bowed her head at the Blessed One’s feet and left his presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i @86b bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i @86b bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then, not long after Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī had left, the Blessed One understood.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag la legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas rnam par grol zhing mthar thug pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag la legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas rnam par grol zhing mthar thug pa nyid thob ste /
translated: “Monks, the son of noble family Nandaka has instructed and taught the five hundred nuns well, and they have attained liberation and the ultimate.

original: 'di'i tshe dus byed par gyur na de dag gis lam gdags su med de 'di nyid sdug bsngal gyi mthar gyur pa la ltos /
analyzed: 'di'i tshe dus byed par gyur na de dag gis lam gdags su med de 'di nyid sdug bsngal gyi mthar gyur pa la ltos /
translated: When they die, they will not be able to be reborn in the lower realms. See how this is the end of suffering for them.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Monks, it is like this.

original: dper na zla ba yar gyi ngo de nyid kyi tshes bco lnga la bab pa na /
analyzed: dper na zla ba yar gyi ngo de nyid kyi tshes bco lnga la bab pa na /
translated: For example, on the fifteenth day of the waxing phase of the moon,

original: mi dag zla ba nya'am nya ma yin zhes gnyis su 'byed par mi byed de 'di ltar nya yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa nyid du gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mi dag zla ba nya'am nya ma yin zhes gnyis su 'byed par mi byed de 'di ltar nya yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa nyid du gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: people do not distinguish between the moon being full or not full. Because it is full, it has reached its culmination.

original: rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag la legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas rnam par grol zhing mthar thug pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dga' byed kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag la legs par gtams shing legs par rjes su bstan nas rnam par grol zhing mthar thug pa nyid thob ste /
translated: In the same way, son of noble family, Nanda has thoroughly instructed and thoroughly taught the five hundred nuns, and they have attained complete liberation and reached their culmination.

original: 'di'i tshe dus byed par 'gyur na de dag gis lam gdags su med de 'di nyid sdug bsngal gyi mthar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i tshe dus byed par 'gyur na de dag gis lam gdags su med de 'di nyid sdug bsngal gyi mthar gyur pa yin no //
translated: When they die at this time, there is no path to be designated, and this is the end of suffering.

original: de ltar de na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag mchog nyid du lung bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po dag mchog nyid du lung bstan to //
translated: In this way, the Blessed One has prophesied the five hundred nuns to be supreme.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
translated: This is what happened.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddha did not immediately establish the bases of training for the hearers in the Vinaya.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis res kyis dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis res kyis dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “The most senior monks should teach the nuns in turn.”

original: dge slong drug sde dag la dge slong @87a *//
analyzed: dge slong drug sde dag la dge slong @87a *//
translated: When it was the turn of the group of six monks to teach the nuns,🔽they taught them as much as they knew.

original: ma la ston pa'i res bab pa na de dag ji tsam ba de tsam bstan nas /
analyzed: ma la ston pa'i res bab pa na de dag ji tsam ba de tsam bstan nas /
translated: They then made fun of them,

original: de dag dang lhan cig mtho 'tsham par byed /🔽kun tu rtse bar byed /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig mtho 'tsham par byed / kun tu rtse bar byed /
translated: played with them,

original: kun tu ca co 'don par byed /
analyzed: kun tu ca co 'don par byed /
translated: and made a lot of noise.

original: gzhog stegs dang phyar g-yeng dang lus sgyur ba byed de /🔽de na gang dag bdag gir byed pa de dag ni de dag dang lhan cig mtho 'tsham par byed /
analyzed: gzhog stegs dang phyar g-yeng dang lus sgyur ba byed de /🔽de na gang dag bdag gir byed pa de dag ni de dag dang lhan cig mtho 'tsham par byed /
translated: They sat on beds and benches with their feet up, and they twisted their bodies.🔽Those who were jealous of the group of six monks said, “They are making fun of the nuns, playing with them, making a lot of noise, sitting on beds and benches with their feet up, and twisting their bodies.”

original: kun tu rtse bar byed /
analyzed: kun tu rtse bar byed /
translated: They play around,

original: kun tu ca co 'don par byed /
analyzed: kun tu ca co 'don par byed /
translated: make loud noises,

original: gzhog stegs dang phyar g-yeng dang / lus sgyur bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhog stegs dang phyar g-yeng dang / lus sgyur bar byed do //
translated: and move their bodies on benches, in the air, and on the ground.🔽Those who do not do these things live in the walkways, the courtyards, and the doorways, and they show us their bad behavior.”

original: gang dag bdag gir mi byed pa de dag ni 'chag sa dag dang / dang ra dag dang / sgo khang dag na gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa 'di lta bu dag bdag cag la kun tu ston par byed do zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: gang dag bdag gir mi byed pa de dag ni 'chag sa dag dang / dang ra dag dang / sgo khang dag na gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa 'di lta bu dag bdag cag la kun tu ston par byed do zhes smod par byed /
translated: They criticize,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and they gossip.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o //
translated: “You should not appoint the group of six as teachers of the nuns.”

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: “The Blessed One has said that we should not appoint the group of six as teachers of the nuns.”

original: de dag gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur nas /
translated: When they appointed one another to teach the nuns, the same problem occurred.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ma bskos par dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma bskos par dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: “You should not teach the nuns without being appointed.”

original: de dag gis mtshams kyi phyi rol tu dong ste gcig gis gcig bskos nas dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag gis mtshams kyi phyi rol tu dong ste gcig gis gcig bskos nas dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur nas /
translated: When they went outside the monastery zone and appointed one another to teach the nuns, the same problem occurred.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol tu bskos pas dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol tu bskos pas dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: “You should not teach the nuns after being appointed outside the monastery zone.”

original: @87b de dag gis mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyis 'dun pa blangs te /
analyzed: @87b de dag gis mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyis 'dun pa blangs te /
translated: The sick monks in the monastery zone invited the nuns.

original: lhag ma rnams brel bar byas nas gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams brel bar byas nas gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“In the same place, the sick monks should be given the consent. The remaining monks should not be busy and appoint one of their number to teach the nuns.

original: mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyi 'dun pa blangs te lhag ma rnams brel bar byas nas gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya bar 'di ltar gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyi 'dun pa blangs te lhag ma rnams brel bar byas nas gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya bar 'di ltar gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: In this way, on the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony,

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa na /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa na /
translated: when the entire Saṅgha is seated and in agreement,

original: dge slong ma'i ston pa bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ston pa bsko bar bya'o //
translated: the teacher of the nuns should be appointed.

original: 'di ltar bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsko bar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be appointed.

original: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
translated: First, they should be encouraged.

original: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge slong ma'i ston par spro'am /
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge slong ma'i ston par spro'am /
translated: ‘Are you, named so-and-so, able to be the teacher of the nuns?’

original: gal te spro na spro'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te spro na spro'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If they are able, they should say, ‘I am able.’

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: After that, a single monk should make a motion and perform the rite.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong ma'i ston par spro na gal te dge 'dun gyis dus la bab cing bzod na /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong ma'i ston par spro na gal te dge 'dun gyis dus la bab cing bzod na /
translated: If this monk so-and-so is willing to be the teacher of the nuns, and if the time has come for the saṅgha and you accept it,

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bskos te dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'di dge slong ma la ston to //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bskos te dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'di dge slong ma la ston to //
translated: then the saṅgha will appoint the monk so-and-so as the teacher of the nuns. The monk so-and-so will teach the nuns.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong ma'i ston par spro na de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bskos @88a *//
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong ma'i ston par spro na de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bskos @88a *//
translated: If this monk so-and-so is willing to be the teacher of the nuns, then for that the saṅgha will appoint the monk so-and-so as the teacher of the nuns.

original: te / dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong ma la ston na /
analyzed: te / dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong ma la ston na /
translated: “The monk named so-and-so is the teacher of the nuns.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang mi gsungs shig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang mi gsungs shig /
translated: Those who are in agreement that the monk named so-and-so be appointed as the teacher of the nuns should remain silent.

original: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig /
analyzed: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig /
translated: Those who do not agree should speak.🔽The Saṅgha has appointed the monk named so-and-so as the teacher of the nuns.

original: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bskos lags te 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge slong ma'i ston par bskos lags te 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there are no objections, this is how it will be upheld.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma'i ston pa bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma'i ston pa bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: “The teacher of the nuns should be appointed,” the Blessed One said.

original: de dag bus pa yang rung /
analyzed: de dag bus pa yang rung /
translated: “They appointed as the teacher of the nuns a monk who was a child,

original: rmongs pa yang rung /🔽mi gsal ba yang rung /
analyzed: rmongs pa yang rung / mi gsal ba yang rung /
translated: a monk who was foolish,🔽a monk who was unclear,

original: mi mkhas pa yang rung ste bye brag med par bsko bar byed nas /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa yang rung ste bye brag med par bsko bar byed nas /
translated: and a monk who was unskilled.

original: de dag re zhig bdag nyid ma dul bas gzhan 'dul bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med pa dang / bdag nyid ma zhi bas gzhan zhi bar byed pa de ni gnas med pa dang / bdag nyid 'dam las ma rgal bas gzhan 'dam las sgrol bar byed pa de ni gnas med pa dang /
analyzed: de dag re zhig bdag nyid ma dul bas gzhan 'dul bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med pa dang / bdag nyid ma zhi bas gzhan zhi bar byed pa de ni gnas med pa dang / bdag nyid 'dam las ma rgal bas gzhan 'dam las sgrol bar byed pa de ni gnas med pa dang /
translated: It is impossible for someone who is not self-disciplined to discipline others. It is impossible for someone who is not peaceful to bring peace to others. It is impossible for someone who has not crossed the swamp to help others cross the swamp.

original: de dag re zhig bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pas gzhan yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa de yang gnas med pas /
analyzed: de dag re zhig bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pas gzhan yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa de yang gnas med pas /
translated: It is impossible for someone who has not attained nirvana to help others attain nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: chos lnga dang ldan pa dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos lnga dang ldan pa dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bya ste /
translated: “Monks, you should appoint a teacher who has five qualities.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / gnas brtan rgyal tshab lta bu dang / grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan pa dang / des dge slong ma la lus kyis reg pas sun ma phyung zhing gal te sun phyung na yang des @88b ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / gnas brtan rgyal tshab lta bu dang / grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan pa dang / des dge slong ma la lus kyis reg pas sun ma phyung zhing gal te sun phyung na yang des @88b ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byas pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with morality, is learned, is like an elder regent, speaks the vernacular, and has not defiled a nun by physical contact. Even if he has defiled her, he has confessed that transgression in accordance with the Teaching.

original: ji ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
