analyzed: de zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags na de yang ma lobs pa yin la /
translated: He has been reciting a single verse for three months and still has not learned it.

original: dge slong ma rnams ni sde snod gnyis pa dang sde snod gsum pa dang / chos sgrog pa rig pa dang / grol ba'i spobs pa can dag @101b yin na /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams ni sde snod gnyis pa dang sde snod gsum pa dang / chos sgrog pa rig pa dang / grol ba'i spobs pa can dag @101b yin na /
translated: The nuns are masters of the two baskets of scripture, masters of the three baskets of scripture, and they are expounders of the Dharma, with knowledge and the eloquence of liberation.

original: des ji ltar dge slong ma la ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ji ltar dge slong ma la ston par 'gyur /
translated: How could he be a teacher to the nuns?”

original: bdag cag ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis zil gyis mnan pa ltar ni ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug po dag gis kyang bud med kyi yul 'ga' yang zil gyis ma mnan to //
analyzed: bdag cag ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis zil gyis mnan pa ltar ni ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug po dag gis kyang bud med kyi yul 'ga' yang zil gyis ma mnan to //
translated: “Just as the Blessed One has overpowered us, so too the ninety-six non-Buddhist ascetics have not overpowered women in the least.”

original: dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde dag gis de ltar 'phags pa lam pa dge slong ma la ston par 'ong ngo zhes thos nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde dag gis de ltar 'phags pa lam pa dge slong ma la ston par 'ong ngo zhes thos nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: When the group of twelve nuns heard that the noble Pūrṇa was coming to teach the nuns, they said,

original: phu nu mo dag bdag cag gis ci nas kyang phyin chad thos pa nyung ngu 'ga' yang dge slong ma la ston par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu zan mo'i bu de mi dga' bar bya'o zhes de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: phu nu mo dag bdag cag gis ci nas kyang phyin chad thos pa nyung ngu 'ga' yang dge slong ma la ston par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu zan mo'i bu de mi dga' bar bya'o zhes de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Sisters, let us do something to make the son of Ārāḍa unhappy so that from now on no one with little learning will come to teach the nuns.”

original: phu nu mo dag bdag cag las mi mo drug gis ni yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag las seng ge'i khri shoms shig /
analyzed: phu nu mo dag bdag cag las mi mo drug gis ni yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag las seng ge'i khri shoms shig /
translated: “Sisters, let six of us prepare lion thrones made of twelve cubits of wood.

original: mi mo drug gis ni mnyan yod du zhugs la lam po che dang / srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag tu skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang bdag cag dge slong ma'i ston pa nyan thos chen po 'di 'dra ba zhig byon par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi mo drug gis ni mnyan yod du zhugs la lam po che dang / srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag tu skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang bdag cag dge slong ma'i ston pa nyan thos chen po 'di 'dra ba zhig byon par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Six women entered Śrāvastī and announced to the crowds in the streets, alleys, crossroads, and intersections, “Tomorrow, we will have a great śrāvaka as our teacher, a bhikṣuṇī like this one.

original: khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong bar ma gyur pa des yun ring por 'khor bar 'khor bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes sgrogs shig /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong bar ma gyur pa des yun ring por 'khor bar 'khor bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro // zhes sgrogs shig /
translated: Those of you who have not seen the truths will have to wander in saṃsāra for a long time.”

original: de dag las mi mo drug gis ni yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag las seng ge'i khri bshams so //
analyzed: de dag las mi mo drug gis ni yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag las seng ge'i khri bshams so //
translated: Six women set up lion thrones twelve cubits high.

original: mi mo drug gis ni mnyan yod du zhugs te lam po che dang / srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag tu skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang bdag cag dge slong ma'i ston pa nyan thos chen po 'di 'dra ba zhig byon par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi mo drug gis ni mnyan yod du zhugs te lam po che dang / srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag tu skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang bdag cag dge slong ma'i ston pa nyan thos chen po 'di 'dra ba zhig byon par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Six women entered Śrāvastī and announced to the crowds in the streets, alleys, crossroads, and intersections, “Tomorrow, we will have a great śrāvaka as our teacher, a bhikṣuṇī like this one.

original: khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong @102a *//
analyzed: khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong @102a *//
translated: Whoever among you has not seen the truths should do so,🔽otherwise you will have to wander in cyclic existence for a long time.”

original: bar ma gyur pa des yun ring por 'khor bar 'khor bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrags pa dang / srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
analyzed: bar ma gyur pa des yun ring por 'khor bar 'khor bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrags pa dang / srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of living beings gathered there, some out of curiosity,

original: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na der 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na der 'dus par gyur to //
translated: and some because they were urged on by their past roots of virtue.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /🔽lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos / lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: Then, the venerable Pūrṇa, having passed the night, in the morning, putting on his lower and upper robes,🔽taking his bowl, entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: de mnyan yod du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pas lhung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab ste /
analyzed: de mnyan yod du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pas lhung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab ste /
translated: Having gone for alms in Śrāvastī, after finishing his meal, he returned from his alms round. Putting away his bowl and robes,

original: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
translated: and washing his feet, he entered the monastery for the purpose of meditation.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa phye ma bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te snam sbyar thogs nas phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong dge slong zhig dang dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa phye ma bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te snam sbyar thogs nas phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong dge slong zhig dang dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then the venerable Upāli, having risen from his seclusion in the morning, taking his robe and carrying his bowl, went with a following of monks to the nunnery of the king’s park.

original: skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis de mthong nas /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis de mthong nas /
translated: A great crowd of people saw him,

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: and they said,

original: dge slong ma'i ston pa de gang yin /🔽ci dge sbyong snga ma yin nam /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ston pa de gang yin / ci dge sbyong snga ma yin nam /
translated: “Who is the teacher of the nuns?”🔽“Is it the former ascetic?”

original: 'on te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong yin /
analyzed: 'on te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong yin /
translated: “Or is it the one who follows after him?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: khyed kyis phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong 'ga' zhig dge slong ma la ston par byed ces thos sam /
analyzed: khyed kyis phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong 'ga' zhig dge slong ma la ston par byed ces thos sam /
translated: “Have you heard that someone who follows after him teaches the nuns?”

original: dge sbyong snga ma 'di nyid dge slong ma'i ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong snga ma 'di nyid dge slong ma'i ston pa yin no //
translated: “This very former ascetic is the teacher of the nuns.”🔽They said,

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽🔽

original: 'dis zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig @102b bklags na de yang ma lobs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dis zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig @102b bklags na de yang ma lobs pa yin na /
translated: If he cannot even memorize a single verse in three months,🔽how will he teach the nuns who are experts in two or three scriptural collections,

original: des dge slong ma sde snod gnyis pa dang / sde snod gsum pa dang / chos sgrogs pa /
analyzed: des dge slong ma sde snod gnyis pa dang / sde snod gsum pa dang / chos sgrogs pa /
translated: who are expounders of the Dharma,

original: rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can dag la ji ltar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can dag la ji ltar ston par 'gyur /
translated: who are endowed with eloquence that is both learned and liberated?”

original: dge sbyong ma sgre byi mo 'di dag gis bdag cag brid par gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma sgre byi mo 'di dag gis bdag cag brid par gyur gyi /
translated: “These deceitful nuns have deceived us.

original: tshur sheg 'dong ngo //
analyzed: tshur sheg 'dong ngo //
translated: Let’s go back!”

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others said,

original: ji lta byed pa yang bltas te re zhig sdod cig /
analyzed: ji lta byed pa yang bltas te re zhig sdod cig /
translated: “Let’s see what he does. Let’s wait a bit.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa 'khor de'i nang du zhugs nas seng ge'i khri ga la ba der song ba dang / ji tsam na yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag las seng ge'i khri bshams pa mthong nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa 'khor de'i nang du zhugs nas seng ge'i khri ga la ba der song ba dang / ji tsam na yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag las seng ge'i khri bshams pa mthong nas des bsams pa /
translated: Then Venerable Maudgalyāyana entered the assembly and went to the lion throne. When he saw the lion throne set up on branches twelve cubits long, he thought,

original: ci re zhig dad par gyur pa dag gis bshams pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci re zhig dad par gyur pa dag gis bshams pa yin nam /
translated: “Did the faithful set it up?

original: 'on te mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams pa yin snyam na /
translated: “Or is it the work of those who wish to harm me?”

original: ji tsam na mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams par mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that it was the work of those who wished to harm him.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas /🔽glang po'i sna lta bu'i lag pa brkyang ste seng ge'i khri de ji ltar gnas su bzhag pa de ltar mnan nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ci nas kyang kha cig gis mthong /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas / glang po'i sna lta bu'i lag pa brkyang ste seng ge'i khri de ji ltar gnas su bzhag pa de ltar mnan nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ci nas kyang kha cig gis mthong /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa

original: kha cig gis ni ma mthong ba de ltar seng ge'i khri la 'dug go /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni ma mthong ba de ltar seng ge'i khri la 'dug go /
translated: extended his arm like an elephant’s trunk and pressed down on the lion throne as it was placed, and the venerable Pūrṇa sat on the lion throne in such a way that some saw him and some did not.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa entered into this kind of meditative absorption:

original: ji ltar sems mnyam par bzhag na rang gi stan las mi snang bar gyur cing shar phyogs kyi steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: ji ltar sems mnyam par bzhag na rang gi stan las mi snang bar gyur cing shar phyogs kyi steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: When his mind was in equipoise, he disappeared from his seat and rose up into the sky above in the east.

original: spyod lam bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: He manifested the four modes of conduct:

original: 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dag byed do //🔽me'i khams @103a *//
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dag byed do // me'i khams @103a *//
translated: He walks, stands, sits, and lies down.

original: la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: He enters the fire element.

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam pa me'i khams la yang snyoms par zhugs pa'i lus las 'od zer sna tshogs 'di lta ste sngon po dag dang / ser po dag dang / dmar po dag dang / dkar po dag dang / btsod ka dag dang / shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam pa me'i khams la yang snyoms par zhugs pa'i lus las 'od zer sna tshogs 'di lta ste sngon po dag dang / ser po dag dang / dmar po dag dang / dkar po dag dang / btsod ka dag dang / shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung ngo //
translated: The Venerable Mālunkyāputta, having entered the fire element, emitted various rays from his body: blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, and silver-colored.

original: cho 'phrul zung dag kyang rnam par ston te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul zung dag kyang rnam par ston te /
translated: He also displayed the double miracle:

original: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
translated: fire blazing from the lower part of his body and a stream of cold water flowing from the upper part of his body;

original: lus kyi stod nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi stod nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
translated: fire blazing from the upper part of his body and a stream of cold water flowing from the lower part of his body.

original: shar phyogs su ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: shar phyogs su ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as in the east, so also in the south, west, and north.

original: de phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bzhi bstan nas rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de phyir bsdus te 'khor gyi gong du seng ge'i khri bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
analyzed: de phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bzhi bstan nas rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de phyir bsdus te 'khor gyi gong du seng ge'i khri bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
translated: He then withdrew his miraculous power and sat down on the lion throne in front of the assembly.

original: 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas dge slong ma rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas dge slong ma rnams la smras pa /
translated: Then the Venerable Revata said to the nuns:

original: sring mo dag kho bos zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig bzung ste /
analyzed: sring mo dag kho bos zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig bzung ste /
translated: “Sisters, I have memorized a verse in three months.

original: kho bo tshigs su bcad pa de nyid nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar du tshig gzhan dag dang yi ge gzhan dag dang tshig dang yi ge gzhan dag gis don rnam par 'byed par spro'o //
analyzed: kho bo tshigs su bcad pa de nyid nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar du tshig gzhan dag dang yi ge gzhan dag dang tshig dang yi ge gzhan dag gis don rnam par 'byed par spro'o //
translated: I am willing to explain the meaning of that verse for seven days and nights with different words, different letters, and different phrases and letters.”

original: sring mo dag de la lus zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum mi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: sring mo dag de la lus zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum mi bya ba bstan to //
translated: “Sisters, by ‘body’ the Blessed One taught that one should not commit the three misdeeds of the body.

original: ngag ces bya bas ni /
analyzed: ngag ces bya bas ni /
translated: By ‘speech’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ngag gis nyes par spyod pa bzhi mi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ngag gis nyes par spyod pa bzhi mi bya ba bstan to //
translated: the Blessed One taught that one should not commit the four misdeeds of speech.

original: yid kyis zhes bya @103b bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yid kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum mi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: yid kyis zhes bya @103b bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yid kyis nyes par spyod pa gsum mi bya ba bstan to //
translated: The word mentally indicates the three mental misdeeds that the Blessed One taught to avoid.

original: sdig pa mi bya zhing zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: sdig pa mi bya zhing zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The words do not commit evil indicate the Blessed One's teaching to avoid all evil.

original: 'jig rten kun la zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po thams cad bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po thams cad bstan to //
translated: The words in the world indicate the Blessed One's teaching of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: yongs 'dzin zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: yongs 'dzin zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The word grasping

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: indicates the three kinds of grasping taught by the Blessed One:

original: 'dod chags kyi yongs 'dzin dang / zhe sdang gi yongs 'dzin dang / gti mug gi yongs 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi yongs 'dzin dang / zhe sdang gi yongs 'dzin dang / gti mug gi yongs 'dzin to //
translated: grasping at desire, grasping at hatred, and grasping at delusion.

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam pas ji tsam gyis tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don kyang rnam par phye ba de tsam gyis srog chags khri nyis stong gis bden pa dag mthong ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam pas ji tsam gyis tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don kyang rnam par phye ba de tsam gyis srog chags khri nyis stong gis bden pa dag mthong ste /
translated: As many times as the Venerable Panthaka analyzed the meaning of even half a verse, that many times twelve thousand living beings saw the truths.

original: kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /🔽kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas / kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: Some manifested the result of stream-entry.🔽Some manifested the result of once-returning.

original: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: Some manifested the result of non-returning.

original: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Some went forth and manifested arhatship by abandoning all defilements.

original: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: Some generated the mind of the śrāvaka enlightenment.

original: kha cig gis ni rang byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rang byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: Some generated the mind of the pratyekabuddha enlightenment.

original: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Some generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'khor phal cher ni sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab par bkod do //
analyzed: 'khor phal cher ni sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab par bkod do //
translated: The majority of the assembly was established in devotion to the Buddha, in devotion to the Dharma, and in devotion to the Saṅgha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas 'khor de dag phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / @104a *//
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas 'khor de dag phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / @104a *//
translated: Then the Venerable Māluṅkyāputta, having understood the thoughts, ponderings, and reflections in the minds of those in the assembly, spoke these verses to the monks:🔽“Those who are not free from doubt,🔽who are not free from uncertainty,🔽

original: dge 'dun la bab par rnam par bkod nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bab par rnam par bkod nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: Then the Venerable Māluṅkyāputta, having established the majority of the assembly in the Buddha, in the Teaching, and in the Community, rose from his seat and left.

original: dge slong dag rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo na 'chag cing 'khod pa de dag gis /
analyzed: dge slong dag rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo na 'chag cing 'khod pa de dag gis /
translated: The monks who were walking and sitting in the courtyard of the Jetavana

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam pa thag ring po kho na nas 'ong ba mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam pa thag ring po kho na nas 'ong ba mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa deng tshe dang ldan pa lam pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ji snyed cig mngon par ma dad par byas /

analyzed: sus ma dad pa byas /

analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //

analyzed: 'khor phal cher ni sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang chos la 'bab pa dang dge 'dun la bab par rnam par bkod do //
translated: The majority of the assembly was established in devotion to the Buddha, in devotion to the Dharma, and in devotion to the Saṅgha.🔽Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: dge slong dag nga'i nyan thos sems bsgyur ba la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste /

analyzed: lam pa 'di ni mchog yin no //

analyzed: de lta bas na chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs so //
translated: Therefore, this is excluded from those who have this kind of Dharma.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, gave a discourse on Dharma that was consistent with that, that was in harmony with that, and that was appropriate to that.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /

analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /

translated: “Monks, if a monk teaches nuns without being appointed to do so, except in the case of a teaching like this, he commits an offense entailing confession.”🔽As for “Monks”:

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽dge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba ni /🔽de @105a *// bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyis so //

original: ma bskos par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bskos par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “without being appointed to do so”:

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis so //
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis so //

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “nuns”:🔽those who have gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: chos 'di ba la'o //
analyzed: chos 'di ba la'o //
translated: As for “teaching”:

analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: the higher morality, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.🔽Except in the case of a teaching like this:

original: chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa bzhag ste'o //
translated: except in the case of a teaching like this, which is set aside.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: “Offense entailing confession” means that [the monk] will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the lower realms, such as the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: He will be burned and cooked.🔽He will be fallen into the lower realms.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and disclosed, it will be an obstruction to wholesome qualities. Therefore, it is called an offense entailing confession.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na; dge slong dge 'dun gyis bskos kyang mtshams kyi phyi rol tu bskos shing mtshams kyi nang du ma bskos na /

translated: How does one commit an offense? If a monk is appointed by the Saṅgha, but is appointed outside the boundary and not inside the boundary,

original: gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: then those who appoint him commit an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: de bskos pa des dge slong ma la ston na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that appointed monk teaches nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong dge 'dun gyis mtshams kyi nang du bskos shing mtshams kyi phyi rol tu ma bskos kyang gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la ma bskos na gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /

analyzed: de bskos pa des dge slong ma la ston na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun gyis mtshams kyi nang du bskos shing mtshams kyi phyi rol tu ma @105b bskos te /

analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la bskos kyang dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun pa ma yin na /

original: gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: then those who appoint him commit an offense of wrong conduct.

translated: “If that appointed monk teaches the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun gyis mtshams kyi nang du bskos shing mtshams kyi phyi rol tu ma bskos te /
translated: “If the saṅgha of monks appoints someone within the boundaries but not outside the boundaries,🔽and if he is appointed on the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony, and the whole saṅgha is present but not in agreement,

analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la bskos shing dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma yin na /

analyzed: gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /

translated: If a monk is appointed within the boundaries by the saṅgha, but not outside the boundaries, and on the very fifteenth day of the purification and restoration observance, the entire saṅgha is present and in agreement,

analyzed: de yang tshul khrims dang ldan zhing mang du thos la gnas brtan rgyal tshab lta bu yin zhing grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan yang 'di ltar des dge slong ma la lus kyis reg pas sun phyung bar gyur cing des ltung ba de yang chos bzhin du phyir
translated: If he speaks the language of the city and thus corrupts the nuns by physical contact and does not confess that downfall in accordance with the teaching,

analyzed: ma byas na gang dag sko bar byed pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: then those who appoint him commit an offense of wrong conduct.

translated: If he has not caused a nun to lose her respect through physical contact,

translated: and if he has confessed that downfall in accordance with the teaching, but is unable to explain in detail the eight rules that are grounds for defeat, then the monks who appointed him have committed an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: de bskos pa des dge slong ma la ston na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
